title: Ancient Rome's Fast Food Joints
description: One-minute skill: Ancient Rome's Fast Food Joints.

hook.text: Pompeii had over 150 thermopolia â€” ancient fast-food counters serving hot food to Roman citizens.

buildup.text: Most Roman apartments had no kitchens. Cooking fires were banned in upper floors due to fire risk.

discovery.text: Thermopolia served stews, lentils, roasted meats, and spiced wine from terracotta pots built into stone counters.

twist.text: The Romans considered eating out low-class. Wealthy citizens dined at home; street food was for the masses.

climax.text: Excavated thermopolia still have food residue â€” scientists identified pork, fish, snails, and grain from 79 AD.

punchline.text: Fast food didn't start with McDonald's. It started 2,000 years ago in Pompeii.
